meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Prozac Debate Revived Two psychiatrists have renewed the debate about Prozac and similar drugs by suggesting that they pose a risk of neurological side effects, with long-term use causing brain damage.

Prozac Debate Revived Two psychiatrists have renewed the debate about Prozac and similar drugs by suggesting that they pose a risk of neurological side effects, with long-term use causing brain damage.

Syria's New President In his inaugural speech, Bashar al-Assad focused on repairing his country's ailing economy and gave no sign that he would be any more flexible than his late father in negotiating peace with Israel.

Move Against Putin Boris Berezovsky, Russian tycoon and politician, said he would leave Parliament and form an alliance of big business and regional politicians to curb President Vladimir V. Putin's growing power.

West Nile Spraying Planned The discovery of two dead crows infected with the West Nile virus on Staten Island prompts New York City officials to begin spraying pesticide in an attempt to kill mosquitoes that carry the disease.
